item.title: Fuel Management System (FSMC A/ FSMC B) – Reserve Tanks Fueled

remarks.para: One card may be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 fueled provided:

numlitem.para: Zero Fuel Weight CG limit is 4% MAC forward of the Aft Limit,
If fuel in reserve tanks 2 or 3 does not transfer, observe 325 KIAS/0.92M speed limitation for remainder of flight, and
Main tanks 2 and 3 fuel quantity indicating systems are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: If reserve tanks 2 and 3 are fueled, and additional failure may occur en route and cause fuel to become trapped in the reserve tanks. Operating procedures must therefore include the following:
Plan required fuel load considering that fuel may become trapped in both reserve tanks.

note.para: Observe fuel quantity indication and confirm fuel transfer from the reserve tanks when either main tank 2 or 3 quantity is reduced below 40,000 lbs. This is necessary since EICAS annunciation may not occur after subsequent failure en route.

numlitem.para: If fuel in reserve tanks does not transfer, limit maximum operating speed to 325 KCAS/.92 Mach.

note.para: Lateral imbalance due to one reserve tank full and one reserve tank empty is less than the max lateral imbalance allowable.

numlitem.para: Aircraft is to be loaded so that ZFW CG limit is 4% MAC forward of the Aft Limit.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "A or B FUEL MGMT SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: FUEL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (FSMC A/FSMC B)
maintenance.para: Verify one of the FSMCs is operative by performing the FSMC operational test (AMM 28-13/501).

para.emphasis: MS NOTE: The Fuel Management Systems include:

numlitem.para: Two Fuel System Management Cards - FSMC A and FSMC B.
Input signals to FSMC A and FSMC B.

maintenance.para: The status message M2/M3 <6K SIG indicates that a reserve (R2 or R3) fuel-transfer-control-signal may have failed. Possible input signal failures are:
For item 1 above, dispatch is allowed with one In-Air signal failed. Dispatch is also allowed with both In-Air failed provided both reserve tanks remain empty.
For items 2, 3, and 4 above, refer to applicable MELs for dispatch.
